body.name: Her Mysterious Duke: A Historical Regency Romance Novel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kenneth and Joanna
reviews.reviewText: The premise of the book focuses on the hero and heroine who want to avoid marriage, one arranged by her father, and the other, relentless pressure from his mother. They agree to pretend to court to avoid their family’s pressures and expectations, but agree they must follow the rule of never falling love. Joanna and Kenneth are both carrying heavy emotional burdens that prevent them from opening their hearts. I am a big fan of this author, and once again I was not disappointed. She takes a fake courtship, weaves in a great supporting cast, crafting a few with nefarious intentions, all in an effort to add in drama. In addition, there is another side story that brings a mystery into the plot. She slowly releases hints and clues teasing the reader with knowledge that something more dramatic was soon to occur. I enjoy the build-ups. This is a great read. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Friends to lovers
reviews.reviewText: Well written, second chance friends to lovers story. Great storyline/plot, has amazing characters. Kenneth is a Duke , who has a past that he wants to forget. While Joanna doesn't have any better a life with her father. Each has reasons to make their families leave them alone so they agree to a fake courtship. Add a bunch of orphans into the mix and you have a great story. Lots of action and emotions to deal with. This author has given us another fabulous read to enjoy. Would recommend to everyone.I am an ARC and leave this unbiased, honest review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Kenneth and Joanna did not care for each other when they had their first encounter but when they met the second time things changing things and both of them decided to help each other out by beginning a fake courtship.Why did they suddenly decide on this fake relationship and what were they both afraid of? Meanwhile in the midst of their supposed courtship difficulties arise concerning the orphanage both have always supported. The mystery revolves around her father. How is he involved in this? Then more potentially serious misunderstandings occur that need to be resolved before they finally find their hea. Overall a clean and sweet romance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Her Mysterious Duke
reviews.reviewText: I loved this story. It was very well written with well rounded characters. Finding your soul mate when you have no trust is hard but possible. I found Joanna to be a believably character and watched her grow. Finally and more importantly is the fact that this is the first book in a very long time that had no errors. Hanna is my favorite author but the editing has been very poor. Not her fault , but frustrating still. The story was full and clean and gave me faith in her again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I so enjoyed this book. It had a different plot than usual and I especially liked the fact that it did not contain the same monotonous sex scenes that most of these romance books have. They write page after page about the sex act not changing it much. Guess it makes their books longer. This was emotional and romantic!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I did not enjoy the book, the story is not wonderful and the language is very poor. The author omits the words, 'and' and 'to' when it would have been considered uneducated to do so.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It’s hard to live in the shadow of your late brother. This is a tale set in the past when family and societal expectations dominated lives. Secrets and lies and pretenses exist everywhere. An entertaining story where “a charade” becomes reality.Hanna Hamilton stories are somewhat predictable but the characters and stories are enjoyable. I especially enjoyed the puppy and the idea of helping orphans.I received a free copy of this book. This is my honest opinion of the book, voluntarily posted.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: They start out with a fake courtship so the heroine has time to find a more appropriate match than what her father offers and the hero can get his mother off his back. There is an orphanage that they both are involved with that plays a part in the storyline. Also someone who doesn’t want them to be together. It was a good read with well developed characters and good editing. I enjoyed the read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Against all the odds romance blossomed wasl challenged with so much going on between that sometimes you thought there could never be a happy ending

I loved Joanna and Kenneth's story, by saving each other a wonderful relationship of trust and mutual support developed and led to a HEA. Thankfully they were willing to break their own rules when they realized they didn't apply any more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book with an excellent plot, interesting and well written
